question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the position of President?

This resolves identically to the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This inquiry will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear-cut and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the result is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will Kamala's chances of victory rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Otherwise, it will be deemed NO.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, AND will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves No otherwise.

This question will resolve as Yes if both (1) and (2) resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President, AND will Kamala Harris's chances of winning rise in the coming week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign publicly and officially announces that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election. If such a declaration is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be considered No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's chances of victory improve over the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis? This will be Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It will be No otherwise.

This question will resolve as Yes if both (1) and (2) are Yes.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024, or Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination for a Yes resolution. (b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare he won't pursue the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024, or that Kamala Harris's chances of winning will rise in the coming week as per Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body: (a) Is there a chance that Joe Biden will publicly state before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered a Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official public announcement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the nomination for a Yes outcome. (b) Will the likelihood of Kamala Harris winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as YES if the probability of Harris winning in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves as NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market's closure at the conclusion of Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to be President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if either condition is not met. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution of condition (b).

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away prior to Saturday and still hold the position of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden continues to serve as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET). It will be considered negative if either of the criteria is not fulfilled. Please note that a temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment does not influence the determination of condition (b).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This includes if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Biden is no longer President by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not continue as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). This includes scenarios where he resigns, dies, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., designating his VP as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution, as Acting President is not the same as President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be barred or excluded from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or exclusion is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the given provisions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or excluded from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not barred or excluded from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it is not significant who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and not through speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that on July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves negatively.

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as "No". The question solely determines by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Donald Trump is excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The exclusion or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports, and not from speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements. The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals after the specified date. If Trump is excluded or barred and then reinstated such that on July 15th he is not excluded or barred, the inquiry will be answered negatively.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. All other candidates will be answered with "No". The inquiry is determined solely by who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Donald Trump will be barred from participating in the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) he will secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if at least one of the following scenarios occurs:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This barring or removal must be substantiated by official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be considered valid for resolution. The question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or removed from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being barred or removed from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election. The determination of this resolution is exclusively based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not on who is declared the Republican nominee on the date of the 2024 Presidential Election.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be President by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a collective agreement of reliable news reporting will also be taken into account.

Resolver

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or be incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he does not withdraw, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024? (b) Joe Biden drops out of the race before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this component will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting as a secondary source.

(b) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. The resolution source for this component will be whether Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race by the specified date and time.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President by July 26, 2024? (b) Joe Biden exits the race prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) At any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States. The main source for determining this will be official announcements from the US government, with a consensus of reliable news reports serving as a secondary source.

(b) Joe Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. The source for resolving this part will be whether Biden has withdrawn or is unable to proceed with his campaign by the given date and time.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris become President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, or will Biden drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; (b) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If neither event occurs, this question will resolve to "No."

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to be named President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, or for Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if one of the following situations takes place: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on authoritative information from the US government or a general agreement among reliable news sources; (b) Joe Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If neither of these scenarios happens, the response will be "No."

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring must be validated through official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative narratives, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and will Ted Cruz secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following conditions are satisfied:

(a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

(b) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified from a primary ballot due to the 14th Amendment, or that Ted Cruz will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if at least one of the following scenarios takes place:

(a) Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and is then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve as "No."

(b) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. All other candidates will resolve as "No." This question is open to other candidates that may emerge in the future.

The question will resolve as "No" if neither condition (a) nor condition (b) occurs.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the United States secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if the Olympic Team from the United States achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Olympic Medal Count at the 2024 Paris Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a positive outcome if the United States Olympic Team ranks as the sole highest team at the Paris 2024 Olympics. It will be considered ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not occur before the year 2027. A negative resolution will take place if any other team matches or surpasses the ranking of the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and arranging them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals and top the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals won, followed by Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals in case of ties. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

para_P.title: Will the USA secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver and lead the Olympic Medal Table at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry concludes with a Yes if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (a) The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the sole highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is established based on the quantity of Gold Medals earned, followed by Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals in the event of ties. The question will remain unclear if the Paris Olympics do not occur prior to 2027.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals (b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
(a) This resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

(b) This resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves No if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that at the Paris 2024 Olympics, either (a) the USA secures more Gold medals than Silver medals or (b) the USA leads the Olympic Medal Table?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered true if the United States Olympic Team achieves a greater number of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

(b) This will be deemed true if the United States Olympic Team is the sole highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be considered unclear if the Paris Olympics do not occur before the year 2027. It will be regarded as false if any other team matches or exceeds the ranking of the US team. The medal standings are determined by:
1. Count of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie) Count of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in Silver) Count of Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, based on information from a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues are still quite concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman mentioned in an interview. He chose not to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if there are multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also be enough to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by the market close, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible to the general public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly requiring a subscription fee). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to specific groups (like minors), the question will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The question will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local news outlets that they’ve already dismissed Biden’s prospects for victory in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one is expected to request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to think about ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be through signing a letter as mentioned above, or it might take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals individually informing reporters that they believe Biden should step down will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to resign will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed to a reasonable degree, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th AND will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message, and their names must be made public before the end date.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

If both of these criteria are met within their respective time frames, this question resolves YES. If either or both are not met, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th, and will Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if both of the following stipulations are satisfied:

1. A coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Representatives or Senators collaborates to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 re-election bid, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could involve signing a letter or an alternative method such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same collective communication, and their identities must be disclosed publicly before the deadline.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and final, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

If both of these conditions are fulfilled within the specified time frames, this question will resolve in the affirmative. If either or both conditions are not fulfilled, it will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that: (a) A collective of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it possible for a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators to collaborate in requesting Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could take the form of a signed letter or another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request his withdrawal. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals independently informing journalists that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and asking him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the conclusion of this market. If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this will resolve as NO.

(b) Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

"""

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns more than $284.5 million globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or an equivalent source) verifies it as the record for an R-rated film release

In simpler terms, the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be taken as unofficial until confirmed by the Hollywood press. The target figure we aim for is >$284.5 million internationally... this weekend.

question.body:
Resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Taylor Swift appears in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will resolve YES even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

2. "Deadpool & Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally during this weekend.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (a) Taylor Swift will make a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will achieve the highest opening weekend revenue ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Taylor Swift features in the film "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any capacity, including if only her voice is utilized for a character. This will be marked as YES even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided it is verified by credible independent sources.

2. "Deadpool & Wolverine" earns over $284.5 million worldwide in its opening weekend, as reported, and is recognized by the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) as the record holder for an R-rated movie debut. We are aiming for a total exceeding $284.5 million internationally during this weekend.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, (b) Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift appears in the movie 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

(b) Resolves YES if the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The current record is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million ($152.2 million domestic).

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following will take place: (a) a Taylor Swift appearance in Deadpool and Wolverine, or (b) Deadpool & Wolverine achieving the highest box office opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Taylor Swift is featured in the film 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any capacity, including voice work for a character. It will still be considered YES even if she does not receive credit on IMDB, provided that independent sources confirm her involvement.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film earns over $284.5 million worldwide during its opening weekend based on reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) recognizes it as the record for an R-rated movie launch. The existing record is held by the original Deadpool, which made $284.5 million ($152.2 million domestically).

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** resolution. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being introduced in the future.

For this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition will be satisfied.
(b) Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden resigns from the race prior to July 20, and (b) Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The first condition will be met if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.
(b) Hurd must be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than by who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, or (b) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of these events will take place: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, or (b) Hurd becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Israel to execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date this question is published and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports confirming that an assault attributed to Israel has taken place within the territory of Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name going to be part of the approved candidates list by Iran's Guardian Council for the presidential election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed among the qualified candidates for president by Iran's Guardian Council in the forthcoming election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (b) Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of these events to happen: (a) Israel to execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name to be added to the list of sanctioned presidential candidates by Iran's Guardian Council?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an assault attributed to Israel has taken place within Iran's territory, resulting in the deaths of no fewer than five people.

(b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the list of eligible candidates for the presidency as determined by Iran's Guardian Council for the forthcoming presidential election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, or (b) Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) Israel conducts a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, or (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name is added to the list of candidates approved by Iran's Guardian Council for the presidency?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports of an attack within Iran attributed to Israel resulting in the deaths of at least five people. (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the Guardian Council's roster of eligible candidates for the upcoming presidential election in Iran.

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?

para_P.body: This question will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI issues a *public* report that includes the findings from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **YES** if, on or before June 30, 2024, Anthropic issues a *publicly available* report presenting the outcomes from an *external* entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both OpenAI and Anthropic publish reports with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, both OpenAI and Anthropic publish *public* reports with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of their respective AI models. Specifically: (a) OpenAI must publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) Anthropic must publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Specifically: (a) OpenAI is required to release a public report with findings from an independent entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) Anthropic is required to release a public report with findings from an independent entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the GOP has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In the event of conflicting reports from mainstream sources, an official statement or source from Ohio State will be referenced. Should no election occur before January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. 2. Republican Party in Ohio's 6th District: This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

Resolution criteria:

If there is a discrepancy among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be utilized. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question is considered annulled.
