question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Rishi Sunak will not be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024.

Conversely, if Sunak is successful in being elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the outcome will be **No**.

The resolution must reference [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources, or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is running (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

For the first condition, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For the second condition, resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency). If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both (a) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak will not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Rishi Sunak does not succeed in being elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Regarding the first criterion, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

As for the second criterion, resolution should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources, or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is running (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency). If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this portion will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak does not get elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak does not succeed in being elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Regarding part (a), the identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; what matters is who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Concerning part (b), if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this part will be resolved as **No**. The resolution should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media sources, or an official declaration from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is standing (if he is contesting in any constituency).

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on imports of electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that, before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they have lost hope in Biden's ability to win in November.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request that Biden terminate his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party House Members/Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be through signing a letter as mentioned above, or it could take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

It is required that all five individuals be part of the same group communication. Five individuals independently expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw does not suffice for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden asking him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed prior to the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as collectively speaking with Biden. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before July 20th. Ambiguous cases will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) The European Union declares new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (b) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators press Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties that would apply to the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could take the form of signing a letter or some other method such as jointly discussing with Biden. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Reports of unnamed Democrats will not meet the requirements unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before July 20th. Unclear cases will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective dates: (a) the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, or (b) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

(a) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) Before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time), a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so. This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards NO.

If neither of these criteria are met by their respective dates, this question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens prior to their specified deadlines: (a) the EU declares new tariffs on electric vehicles from China, or (b) a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to withdraw from the race?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: 

(a) By July 5, 2024, credible information indicates that the European Union (EU) has officially stated that new tariffs or duties will be enforced on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) Before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time), a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so. This could manifest as a signed letter or through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively urge him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is inadequate. Reports mentioning unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to step aside will not fulfill the requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the deadline. In cases of uncertainty, the resolution will favor NO.

If neither of these conditions is satisfied by their respective deadlines, this question will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Greece competes in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Greece fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Lithuania set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will both Greece and Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (2) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Greece and Lithuania both make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the following two criteria are fulfilled: (1) Greece takes part in a Semi-final and is formally confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (2) Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is formally confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Greece or Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Greece or Lithuania make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Greece competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania qualifies, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but no more than 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the lead that Donald Trump has over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when it is checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For this question, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(2) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(1) Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 2 and be at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average. This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as reported in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date is Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

(2) Joe Biden will make an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This question will be answered as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. To be considered a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and final: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election. If such a definitive announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

(b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be between 2 and 3 points according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden publicly declare before that date that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Donald Trump holds a lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election that is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as shown on the chart when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead.

(b) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

If neither (a) nor (b) takes place, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will refuse the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear declaration is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

para_P.title: Is it possible that a Trump family member will be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?

Determines **Yes** if any of the following individuals becomes the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. (b) One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will a member of the Trump family be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (a) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for a second term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in 2024. (b) One of the following individuals is the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. If either condition is not fulfilled, this question will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, (b) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of the Democratic Party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

(b) One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Could either of the following take place: (a) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President, (b) A Trump family member becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not run for or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden might accept the nomination.

(b) One of the following individuals is chosen as the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

If neither (a) nor (b) takes place, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to stay in office until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden continues to serve as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be marked as "No" if these circumstances are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024 and (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden stays in office as President until the end of July 2024 and (b) Donald Trump is either removed from or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Biden continues to be the U.S. President until the close of July 2024 (ET); it will be marked as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary handover of authority under the 25th Amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution).

(b) The resolution to this inquiry will be "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially prohibited or removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This prohibition or removal must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media reports. Mere speculation, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution. The outcome will be "No" if these stipulations are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This query does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role based on the cited criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and then later reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through July 2024 or Trump be removed from any primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency until the end of July 2024, or will Trump be disqualified from any primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as YES if one of the following situations occurs: (a) Biden continues as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be marked as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary power shift under the 25th amendment (where his Vice President becomes the Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements are insufficient for resolution. The question will be resolved as "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or changes that may arise after the specified date. It exclusively concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot but later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Liz Cheney be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is appointed as the candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** resolution. This question is not limited to the candidates currently announced; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official statement from an Ohio State source will be utilized. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

(a) Liz Cheney is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection at the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

(b) Reliable sources indicate that a candidate representing the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, which was previously occupied by Bill Johnson. In case of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official statement or source from Ohio will be utilized. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be void.

This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the candidate on the day of the election. (b) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, as reported by credible sources. (b) A representative of the Republican Party secures victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, as confirmed by reliable sources. In the event of conflicting reports, an official source or statement from Ohio will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, this market will resolve to a 50-50 outcome.

The definitive source for this resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology employed by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will settle based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is accessible. The market may not reach a conclusion until the data for July 20 is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve using the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the probability of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The count of simulations from 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the question will be answered with a **No**.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will five or more identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators compel Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two secure-seat members have already publicly encouraged Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local news outlets that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request that Biden end his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five identified Democratic Party House Representatives or Senators collaborate to urge Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it could occur through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not suffice for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and asking him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market closes. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

(2) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. At least 5 qualifying names must be made public before this market's end date. In ambiguous cases, this market will err towards resolving NO.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be appointed as president by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially named as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for resolving this market will be official announcements from the US government, although a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

Resolver

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden be in office as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (An Acting President is not the same as a President according to the Constitution.)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

(b) Resolves YES if Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of these events to take place: (a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President prior to July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden continues to serve as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This market will be deemed "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not happen, the market will be marked "No". The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, though a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

(b) This will resolve as YES if Joe Biden is still the US President at the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will resolve as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his VP as Acting President) will not result in a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris be President by Friday or Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET; or (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET) without resigning, dying, or otherwise ceasing to be President before then. The primary resolution source for (a) will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also being used. For (b), temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a "No" resolution since Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to assume the presidency by Friday, or for Biden to continue as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if one of the following happens: (a) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET; or (b) Joe Biden remains in the position of US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET) without resigning, passing away, or otherwise ending his presidency before that date. The main source for determining (a) will be official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable news reports. Regarding (b), a temporary shift of power under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) will not result in a "No" resolution, as the role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France secure a position in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a positive outcome if France achieves a Top 5 finish (ties will also result in a positive outcome) at the Olympics scheduled for 2024. The result will be uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them by:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties for the first position) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties for the second position) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal, and (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11. Sha'Carri Richardson will compete on the following days:
   - Women's 100m: Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3
   - Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced): Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9

2. France places in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means France must be in the top 5 of the medal table, which is calculated by the number of Gold Medals, followed by Silver Medals in case of a tie, and then Bronze Medals. Ties in placement resolve positively.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves YES. If either or both conditions are not met, it resolves NO. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson secures a gold medal, and (b) France finishes in the Top 5?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Sha'Carri Richardson achieves a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The track and field events will commence on Thursday, August 1, and conclude on Sunday, August 11. Sha'Carri Richardson is scheduled to compete on these dates:
   - Women's 100m: Friday, August 2, to Saturday, August 3
   - Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups yet to be determined): Thursday, August 8, to Friday, August 9

2. France ranks within the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This requires France to be among the top 5 in the medal standings, which are determined first by the number of Gold Medals, followed by Silver Medals in case of a tie, and then Bronze Medals. Ties in placement are resolved in favor of a YES.

If both criteria are satisfied, the inquiry will resolve to YES. If either or both criteria are not satisfied, it will resolve to NO. The inquiry will remain unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will either Sha'Carri Richardson win a gold medal or France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves positively if either of the following occurs: (a) Sha’Carri Richardson wins gold in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field events will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11. Sha'Carri Richardson will compete in Women's 100m on Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3, and potentially in Women's 4x100m Relay on Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9. (b) France places in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table ranking is determined by the number of gold medals, with ties broken by the number of silver and then bronze medals. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Sha'Carri Richardson to secure a gold medal or for France to finish in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be affirmed if at least one of the following happens: (a) Sha’Carri Richardson achieves a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The track and field competitions are scheduled to begin on Thursday, August 1, and end on Sunday, August 11. Sha'Carri Richardson is set to participate in the Women's 100m from Friday, August 2, to Saturday, August 3, and may also compete in the Women's 4x100m Relay on Thursday, August 8, to Friday, August 9. The ranking in the medal table is based on the total number of gold medals, with any ties being resolved by the count of silver and then bronze medals. The inquiry will remain unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Democratic Vice President?

Conversely, if another individual is chosen for the VP position, the market will conclude with a no. Any subsequent changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can settle right after the nomination.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as **No**. (b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this part of the question will resolve to **Yes**. If someone else is selected as VP, this part of the question will resolve to **No**. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this part of the question. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (a) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part of the question will be resolved as **No**. (b) Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic VP, this part of the question will resolve to **Yes**. If another individual is appointed as VP, this part of the question will resolve to **No**. Any changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this part of the question. The market can resolve immediately following the nomination.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, (b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as **No**.

(b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. This will resolve as **Yes** if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this resolves as **No**. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution. The resolution can occur immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, (b) Kamala Harris receives the nomination as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This will be marked as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this will be marked as **No**.

(b) Kamala Harris receives the nomination as the Democratic Vice President. This will be marked as **Yes** if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If another individual is chosen as VP, this will be marked as **No**. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not influence the outcome. The resolution can occur immediately following the nomination.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

It will resolve as **No** if neither or only one of them holds the most seats. para_P.title: Will the GUE/NGL and the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA political faction achieves the highest seat count following the 2024 European Parliament elections. The answer will also be **Yes** if either group has the most seats or if they are tied for that position. The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.
