question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll solicits votes from Manifold participants for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests votes for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion typically indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat included in hypothetical scenarios is polling either ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the general population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for the first poll minus the formula for the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve to N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be appointed as President by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially named as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for resolving this market will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

Resolver

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention and (b) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President before July 26, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this resolves to NO.

The primary resolution source for (b) will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) a subsequent Democratic party presidential debate prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention and (b) Kamala Harris being appointed as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve to YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will resolve to NO if not.

(b) This will resolve to YES if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

The primary source for resolving (b) will be official announcements from the US government, although a consensus from reliable news sources will also be taken into account.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention (b) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following scenarios to take place: (a) a subsequent Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention (b) Kamala Harris being appointed as President or Acting President by July 26, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO in the absence of such a debate.
(b) This market will be marked as "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not happen, the market will be marked as "No".

The main source for resolving this market will be verified information from the US government, although a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will determine if Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden within the range of greater than 3 and up to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being included in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The lead must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to 538's national polling average, and (b) will Vivek Ramaswamy be the chosen Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. The margin must be greater than 3 and at most 4.

(b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates listed below; additional options may be included later. It is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this condition, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but be 4 or lower in 538's national polling average, or will Vivek Ramaswamy secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following criteria is fulfilled: 

(a) The lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential race is more than 3 and at most 4 points as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead.

(b) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This criterion is determined exclusively by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a trustworthy news organization report the event at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
The question will be answered with YES if a prominent and reputable news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news outlets, conspiracy theory websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not be considered adequate.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another Democratic party presidential debate happens (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) An additional presidential debate for the Democratic party occurs (b) Should Joe Biden resign, a trustworthy media source reports on the situation at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked YES if there is a debate involving possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked NO otherwise.

(b) This question will be marked YES if a major and trustworthy media organization like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the resignation with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his resignation official through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not suffice. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not resign before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention (b) Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers it at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) a subsequent Democratic presidential debate occurs prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention (b) Joe Biden withdraws and a credible news source reports it at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in other cases.

(b) Resolves YES if a major and trustworthy media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his official announcement through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an assault linked to Israel and taking place within the territory of Iran has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a credible news organization report the situation no less than 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
The question will be answered YES if a major and trustworthy news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not be considered adequate.

This market will be determined as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (b) if Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Israel executes a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and (b) if Joe Biden withdraws, a trustworthy news source reports the event at least 6 hours ahead of time?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible information suggests that an attack linked to Israel occurring inside Iran has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

(b) The question will resolve as YES if a major and reputable media organization, such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post, reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's formal announcement of his withdrawal via letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024 (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Israel executes a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024 (b) Should Joe Biden withdraw, a trustworthy news source reports the incident at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, credible sources indicate that an assault attributed to Israel occurring within the territory of Iran has resulted in the deaths of no fewer than five people.

(b) The question will resolve YES if a major and reputable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially declares his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage by local news, conspiracy sites, or individual comments on Manifold will not suffice. This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Portugal fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative elections in France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if an official electoral coalition or alliance between Les Républicains and the National Rally is declared before June 30, 2024, based on information from [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If there is no such announcement, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Prime Minister of France will be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the Prime Minister of France's party is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this part resolves as **No**.

2. The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If the Prime Minister belongs to either of these coalitions, this part resolves as **No**.

The final resolution of this question is **Yes** only if both conditions are satisfied; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) The French Republicans (Les Républicains) establish a political partnership with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative elections in France (b) The Prime Minister of France is affiliated with a coalition that is neither the New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will result in **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. An official announcement of an electoral coalition or partnership between the Republicans (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is made before June 30, 2024, as reported by reliable sources. If such a partnership is not declared, this segment resolves as **No**.

2. On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France does not belong to the New Popular Front or Together, according to trustworthy sources. If the Prime Minister is part of either of these coalitions, this segment resolves as **No**.

The overall conclusion of this inquiry is **Yes** only if both criteria are met; otherwise, it concludes as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The Republicans Party of France forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election, or (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this part resolves as **No**. (b) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If the Prime Minister belongs to either New Popular Front or Together, this part resolves as **No**. If either part resolves as **Yes**, the combined question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: By mid-2024, will one of the following take place: (a) The Republicans Party of France collaborates with the National Rally to form a political alliance for the 2024 French legislative election, or (b) The Prime Minister of France is part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) An official electoral alliance or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is declared before June 30, 2024, based on reliable sources. If such an agreement is not made public, this segment will resolve as **No**. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the political party of the Prime Minister of France does not belong to New Popular Front or Together, according to trustworthy sources. If the Prime Minister is affiliated with either New Popular Front or Together, this part will resolve as **No**. If either segment resolves as **Yes**, the overall question will resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be regarded as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility of Biden accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market ahead of time if the outcome is known and clear. You may contact @jskf to request an early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If neither of these events occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Joe Biden makes a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if one of the following happens: (1) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is declared the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 election. (2) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If neither of these situations occurs, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For the purpose of this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys have consistently indicated that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump’s vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close.

To calculate Trump’s vote percentage, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Others)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until the designated closing time.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.body:

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
The answer will be YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024.

The data for determining the outcome will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the precise value without rounding.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) The US Core CPI rises by over 0.1% from June to July 2024, and (b) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024. The data source for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will either the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July or Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: This resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. (b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% in July, or that Biden will be officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: This will be considered a YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% when compared to June 2024, based on the precise (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. (b) The Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President cannot fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the outcome will be a **No**.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Ireland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will both Poland and Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Poland and Ireland participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Poland and Ireland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both Poland and Ireland take part in a Semi-final and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured their spots in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Ireland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Poland or Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Poland nor Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Poland or Ireland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Poland competes in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that it has qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Ireland competes in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that it has qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Poland nor Ireland secures qualification, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the designated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not excluded or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20 AND will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met. Note: For condition (b), the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of that date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race before July 20 AND that Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) Joe Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This exclusion or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled. Note: For condition (b), the inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after July 15, 2024. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified grounds as of that date. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not excluded or barred from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: Will either Biden drop out before July 20 or Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw before July 20, or that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign prior to July 20 at midnight Eastern Time.

(b) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be considered valid for resolution. The inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent changes that might take place after the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will be answered negatively.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Will there be an authorized referendum in Scotland regarding independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Scotland conducts a referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum takes place before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be classified as an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for the referendum to possess any legally binding authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused permission for the vote, nor by a vote arranged by civil society organizations. A referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it certain that Georgia will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In all other scenarios, the result will be **No**.

question.title: Will Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Estonia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Estonia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Estonia fails to qualify, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Georgia and Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Georgia and Estonia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Georgia or Estonia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Georgia and Estonia both set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both Georgia and Estonia take part in a Semi-final and are officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Georgia or Estonia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Georgia or Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Georgia nor Estonia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Georgia or Estonia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Estonia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Georgia nor Estonia qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a reputable news organization report the event a minimum of 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered TRUE if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden formally announces his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. All other contenders will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (2) Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) This resolves as YES if a major and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before his official announcement. The question is N/A if he does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention. 

(2) This resolves as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who is nominated on the election day itself.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (1) In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a trustworthy media source report on it at least 6 hours prior? (2) Will Donald Trump Jr. become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This will be considered YES if a prominent and trustworthy news organization like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it. The question is not applicable if he does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention. 

(2) This will be considered YES if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who is nominated on the day of the election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Joe Biden drops out, this question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This question resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following scenarios to take place: (a) Should Joe Biden withdraw, will a trustworthy news source report the story a minimum of 6 hours beforehand (b) Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) If Joe Biden withdraws, this question will be resolved as YES if a major and trustworthy media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's formal announcement of his withdrawal via letter, speech, etc. Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not suffice. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This question will be resolved as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as NO. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced in the future. The resolution is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be straightforward and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.body:

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control over the area



The inquiry will conclude as **No** if the specified location is not classified under any categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other categories established by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control over the area or absence of Russian control over the area.

(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.
