- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) Russia will have seized control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States during the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and final, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

(b) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as belonging to any of the following categories:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area
The inquiry will resolve as **No** if the location is not classified under any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories established by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control of the area.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Joe Biden will declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Russia will gain control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) By 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign delivers a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, allowing no chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as being under any of the classifications that suggest Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories established by ISW that denote Russian authority over the area.

If neither (a) nor (b) happens, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Inflection will release a report detailing the findings from an independent red-team assessment of their models' safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Inflection, this question will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* entity that has conducted red-teaming on the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the public" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (though it may require a fee). If it is not available in some EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), the resolution will still be **YES**, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The resolution will still be **YES** if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Inflection releases a report detailing findings from an external evaluation of their models regarding safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question will be resolved as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the results from an *independent* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question will be resolved as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** in other cases.

Here, "broadly accessible" signifies that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (potentially requiring payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for instance) minors, this will still be resolved positively, provided that at least over 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be resolved positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, or OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if either of the following occurs: (a) For Inflection, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) For OpenAI, ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it), assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

para_P.title: Will Inflection release a report detailing the findings from an external assessment of their models' safety by June 30, 2024, or will OpenAI's ChatGPT be fully accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **YES** if one of the following takes place: (a) Inflection publishes a *publicly available* report by June 30, 2024, showcasing the findings from an *independent* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models. (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes fully accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Fully accessible" indicates that the typical condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly requiring payment), provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and the resolution will be affirmative if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service remains substantially unchanged.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office debut than the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the domestic box office debut for **Deadpool & Wolverine**, as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1), exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 plus $53,113,752.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but at most 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) experience an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined by the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024 needs to exceed the value reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.
   
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported value on July 20, 2023.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 2 and is at most 3 points on July 15, 2024, as indicated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.
   
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) as reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the value reported on July 20, 2023.

Both criteria must be met for this inquiry to be answered with a YES.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024?

For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If another individual is chosen, the answer will be **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently announced; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it depends solely on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he does not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This decision is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will drop out if he is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. If he does not drop out by this time, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. If any other candidate is chosen, the outcome will be **No**. This determination relies solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will withdraw from the race if he is unable to continue before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. If he has not withdrawn by that deadline, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Biden drops out before July 20?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following will happen: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The selection of any other individual will result in a **No** resolution. This question is not limited to the candidates currently in the running; additional candidates may emerge later. For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) If Biden decides to step down or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

This question will be resolved as "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** resolution. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently in the spotlight; additional candidates may emerge in the future.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are shown to have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the specified resolution date. Any alterations in the method by which FiveThirtyEight computes its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a conclusion based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is accessible. Should there be no data available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the odds of each candidate winning, expressed as a number out of 100 and reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate won will not be taken into account.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) FiveThirtyEight predicts Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:

Please note that the resolution concerns the likelihood of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100 reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The total number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. 

(b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this part resolves 50-50. The resolution will occur when datapoints for July 20 become available, or the nearest previous figures to July 19 if no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either (a) Francis Suarez will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) FiveThirtyEight will indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) The Republican National Convention chooses Francis Suarez as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based exclusively on the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. This determination relies on the data represented by the blue and red trend lines in FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election. If Biden and Trump are projected to have equal chances, this part will resolve 50-50. The final resolution will take place when data points for July 20 are released, or the closest preceding figures to July 19 if July 19 data points are not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than th..."The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25850/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for the Deadpool & Wolverine reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Taylor Swift makes a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine (b) The domestic box office debut of "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceeds the combined earnings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Taylor Swift is seen in the film "Deadpool & Wolverine" in any capacity, including just her voice for a character. It will still be considered YES even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided it is verified by other sources. 

(b) This will be marked as YES if the domestic box office debut for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported on Boxofficemojo is greater than $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. This inquiry will resolve similarly to the original on Metaculus. Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically be applied to this market. Further details can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This would be answered with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker urges Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if an official declaration of Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden die before the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this condition. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count for this condition. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024.

If both (a) and (b) occur, the question resolves YES. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Biden being officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden passing away before the conclusion of Friday, July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

(a) The Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this criterion. Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not satisfy this criterion. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

(b) An official declaration of Joe Biden's death occurs before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024.

If both (a) and (b) take place, the question will be answered with a YES. If not, it will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before August 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, or (b) Joe Biden dies?
question.body:
(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden dies: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens prior to August 2024: (a) Biden is deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (b) Joe Biden passes away?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment: Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) Joe Biden passes away: Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If not, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Is the Pandemic Agreement going to receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is OpenAI going to make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following conditions are satisfied:

- OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement from the company or a representative of the company, such as Sam Altman. The statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote in an interview). The declaration from OpenAI must demonstrate a heightened commitment to the principle compared to the period when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply be a restatement indicating that "we already foster a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one individual from righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact selected signatories or supporters to evaluate their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a positive initial step" for this inquiry to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, and (b) OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus must verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) the Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024, and (b) OpenAI makes a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) At the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, the Pandemic Agreement is endorsed through a vote, as reported by reliable sources.

(b) OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, through a statement issued by the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment in an interview). The communication from OpenAI must demonstrate a new level of dedication to the principle compared to the time when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot merely restate that, for instance, "we already promote a culture of open criticism". Furthermore, Metaculus must confirm that at least one member of righttowarn.ai is satisfied with the company's acceptance of the principle. Metaculus may contact selected signatories or endorsers to evaluate their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements need to be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will either the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly or OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs:

(a) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:
- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Pandemic Agreement will receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024, or that OpenAI will make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) The Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), as reported by reliable sources.

(b) By July 1, 2024, both of the subsequent statements are true:
- OpenAI makes a public declaration of commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle, delivered through an official communication from the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This communication can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment in an interview). The statement must reflect a new commitment level to the mentioned principle compared to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot merely repeat that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has adopted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus might contact certain signatories or endorsers to evaluate their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball during the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will be confirmed as Yes if Team USA achieves victory in both gold medal matches. It will be confirmed as No if either the men's team or the women's team finishes in a position other than first place.

question.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the Philadelphia 76ers going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:

It is answered with **No** if any other team wins, as they would be out of the running.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?

The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Resolves No if either condition is not met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (a) Team USA secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?

The Philadelphia 76ers are recognized as the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals by the NBA. This will be deemed false if either of the criteria is not fulfilled.

(a) Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.
(b) Resolves Yes if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Resolves No for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following to take place: (a) Team USA secures gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?

(a) This will be considered Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. It will be No if either the men's or women's team does not finish in first place.
(b) This will be Yes if the Philadelphia 76ers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as recognized by the NBA. It will be No for any other teams that do not win.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Cyprus set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Cyprus takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Cyprus fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Malta and Cyprus participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta and Cyprus both going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both Malta and Cyprus take part in their individual Semi-finals and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that they have qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if either or both fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Malta nor Cyprus qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta or Cyprus set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either of the following happens: (a) Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Cyprus takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Malta nor Cyprus advances, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: Is it possible for 24 or more world records to be set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the total number of world records established at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or exceeds it.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France secure a position in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a positive outcome if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are considered positive) during the Olympics scheduled for 2024. It will result in an ambiguous resolution if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by tallying the overall number of medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties at 2) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records will be broken (b) France will place in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater. (2) France places in the top 5 in the medal table. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: (1) Number of Gold Medals, (2) (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals, (3) (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A minimum of 24 world records will be shattered (b) France will finish within the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of these criteria are fulfilled at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) At least 24 world records are broken. (2) France secures a position in the top 5 of the medal standings. The medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them by: (1) Total Gold Medals, (2) (In case of a tie for first) Total Silver Medals, (3) (In case of a tie for second) Total Bronze Medals. The question will remain unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will either at least 24 world records be broken or France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Will at least 24 world records be set or will France achieve a Top 5 finish in the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) The total number of world records established during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more. (b) France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are considered as positive outcomes) at the 2024 Olympics. The medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals won by each participating nation and ranking them based on: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Number of Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Number of Bronze Medals. The question remains unclear if the Olympics are not held in 2024.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its nominee for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators indicating this before midnight on July 20 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) the Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) at least 10 Democratic Senators will urge Biden to step aside prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) The Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

(b) At least 10 Democratic Senators will urge Biden to step aside before July 20: Source for resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If it is indicated that there are 10 or more Democratic Senators at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, or (2) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
1. Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

2. 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this resolves to yes. Otherwise, it resolves to no.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (1) Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024, or (2) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20?
para_P.body:
1. Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024: This will be marked as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, it will be marked as **No**.

2. At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20: For resolution, see: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, there are indications of 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to step aside, this will be considered a yes. Otherwise, it will be a no.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users who are deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request an early resolution or to report any issues.

question.body:

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as detailed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead by 2.4 points over Biden, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.
