question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump runs against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he see an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both of which conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these hypotheticals either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public opinion?

This market will settle on YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump votes / (Trump votes + (the Democrat in question) + Other votes)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and that for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the outcome is NO.

These polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is irrespective of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference between the polls must be >= 0.03 for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% support among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This decision is independent of who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on the votes of the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump will secure at least 3% support among Manifold respondents if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the poll against Joe Biden surpasses that in the poll against a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation employed is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference between the two polls must be >= 0.03 for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following occur: 

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll (with Joe Biden on the ballot) exceeds that in the second Manifold poll (with a generic Democrat on the ballot) by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat in the question + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Trump secures at least a 3% increase among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden versus a standard Democrat?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if any of the subsequent conditions are met: 

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen as the candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is solely based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) The vote percentage for Donald Trump in the initial Manifold poll (with Joe Biden listed as a candidate) surpasses that of the second Manifold poll (with a generic Democrat listed) by 3% or more when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation employed is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat in the question + Someone else)). The resolution is YES if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Russia possess authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Declared Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control over the area



The inquiry will be answered with **No** if the location is not categorized under any of the classifications that suggest Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Declared Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any additional classifications created by ISW that signify Ukrainian control over the area or the absence of Russian control over the area.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will be answered negatively.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Russia will hold control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump will be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any state in the U.S. for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

question.title: Will either Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

- Assessed Russian Control

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. para_P.title: On June 1, 2024, will either Russia control Chasiv Yar, or will Donald Trump be barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) **Russia's Control of Chasiv Yar**: On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of these classifications:

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine
- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Previous 24 Hours
- Evaluated Russian Authority
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Russian authority over the area

The inquiry will be marked as **No** if the area is not classified under any of the categories denoting Russian authority, which includes, but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Progress in the Previous 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Any other classifications established by ISW that denote Ukrainian authority over the area or a lack of Russian authority over the area.

(b) **Donald Trump's Exclusion from Ballot**: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The exclusion or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The inquiry will be marked as "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or blocked from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not excluded or blocked from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) expected to increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the data published by the St. Louis Fed found at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. For this question to be affirmed, the figure reported on July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No**. This question may take into account new candidates introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. See: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will exceed its Year-over-Year value on July 20, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) as reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is higher than the figure reported on July 20, 2023. Reference: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(2) This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be classified as **No**. This inquiry may take into account new candidates who may emerge in the future. The determination is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve as **Yes** if the reported number on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed's reporting here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(b) The question about Donald Trump will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. New candidates added in the future may also be considered.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index will be greater Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be determined as **Yes** if the figure reported on July 20, 2024, exceeds the figure reported on July 20, 2023, based on the St. Louis Fed's data found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(b) The inquiry concerning Donald Trump will be deemed **Yes** if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is solely based on the selection made by the Republican National Convention delegates. Future candidates may also be taken into account.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that the head of the Secret Service will step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is there a chance that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to be the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will both Joe Biden die before Saturday and the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if and only if both of the following conditions are met: (1) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (2) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If either condition is not met, this question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday while the head of the Secret Service steps down within the forthcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES only if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (2) Kimberly Cheatle, who is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, either resigns, is dismissed, or for any other cause ceases to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If either of these conditions is not satisfied, the answer to this question will be NO.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden die before Saturday or the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden die before Saturday? Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO. 

(b) Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days? Resolves YES if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday or that the Director of the Secret Service will step down within the next three months?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away before Saturday? This question will be answered with YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If not, the answer will be NO. 

(b) Is it possible for the head of the Secret Service to resign in the upcoming 90 days? This question will be answered with YES if Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason is no longer in her position as director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For the purpose of this inquiry, it does not matter who holds the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive score of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election AND Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election AND will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as determined solely by the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention. (2) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 3 and at most 4, as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. If either criterion is not fulfilled, this inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 3 but is no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved as **Yes** if one of the following scenarios occurs:

(a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than by who is announced as the Republican candidate on election day in 2024.

(b) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as recorded on July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

For a Yes answer, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear declaration is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

When the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users considered trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party going to happen?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO if it does not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? Resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) there will be another debate among Democratic presidential candidates before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would consider accepting the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be an additional debate among Democratic presidential candidates? This resolves as Yes if a debate occurs featuring potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It resolves as No in all other cases.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) there is an additional debate among Democratic presidential candidates?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden going to declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration that he will not run for and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no interpretation that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be answered as No.

(b) Will there be an additional debate among Democratic presidential candidates? This will be answered with Yes if there is a debate featuring potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be No otherwise.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing findings from independent red-teaming of their models regarding safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this inquiry will be deemed **YES** if, prior to June 30, 2024, they make available a *public* report that includes the findings from an *external* organization assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other cases.

Here, "accessible to the general public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be viewed positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) a report detailing the results from external safety evaluations of Google DeepMind's models is published, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question will be answered with **YES** if they release a *public* report by June 30, 2024, showcasing the findings from an *external* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The question will be answered with **YES** if, on June 30, 2024, ChatGPT is widely accessible in the EU, and **NO** if it is not.

The term "widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require a payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to specific groups (like minors), it will still count as a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models, and it will still be considered a positive resolution if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, the question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that by June 30, 2024, one of the following will take place: (a) Google DeepMind releases a report detailing the findings from an external safety evaluation of their models, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) Regarding Google DeepMind, this question will be answered with **YES** if they issue a *public* report by June 30, 2024, showcasing the outcomes of an *independent* assessment on the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Concerning OpenAI's ChatGPT, the question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

Here, "broadly accessible" means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations, or not accessible to (for instance) minors, it will still be considered positively, as long as over 50% of the population can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered positively if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to enter queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they do not advance, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Slovenia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Slovenia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Malta and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Malta and Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Slovenia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta and Slovenia both set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both Malta and Slovenia take part in a Semi-final and are officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Malta or Slovenia fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either Malta or Slovenia will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if neither makes it, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders receive arrest warrants from the International Criminal Court before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below. It will be considered **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between, and including, the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The answer will be No if the aforementioned does not occur.

An incident will be classified as a 'terrorist act' if it is characterized as such by any official agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Before July 1, 2024, the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders; (2) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members:
   * Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
   * Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
   * Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

2. A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as **No** if one or both of the above conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (1) The ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials before July 1, 2024; (2) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) must issue an arrest warrant for any of these Israeli government figures:
   * Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
   * Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
   * Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

2. A terrorist incident occurs in Metropolitan France that results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. An event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will be marked as **No** if either or both of the above criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 11, 2024: (a) The ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders by July 1, 2024, or (b) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) A terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither of the above occurs.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 11, 2024, one of the following takes place: (a) The ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials by July 1, 2024, or (b) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) The International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the following members of the Israeli cabinet before July 1, 2024:
* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

(b) A terrorist incident occurs in Metropolitan France that results in injury or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or any member of the Council of Ministers of France.

The inquiry will be answered with **No** if neither of the aforementioned events occurs.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will there be a face-to-face interview or discussion with Joe Biden on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will conclude with a YES if Biden participates in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will conclude with a NO. 

This market does not account for press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments of interviews featured in programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such instances to be valid. A 50-minute segment could potentially only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus not qualifying. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden will participate in a face-to-face interview/conversation on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will conclude based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. If Biden engages in another such in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve as YES. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve as NO. This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it can include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview that is part of a program like 60 Minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for those appearances to be considered valid. question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be released before the market closes at the end of July, and must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. Qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, but must feature at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

para_P.title: Will either of the following happen: (a) Will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but be 3 or less on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Will Joe Biden engage in an in-person interview or discussion on camera for over 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be deemed YES if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 3, as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

(b) This question will be considered YES if Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting a minimum of 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be made public before the market closes at the end of July and should not consist of press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. Acceptable formats include podcasts, late-night shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, but must include at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden in an in-person interview.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of securing the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will determine a “No” if Donald Trump is perceived to have a superior likelihood of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are deemed to have equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly focusing on the data represented by the blue and red trend lines on the specified resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology employed by FiveThirtyEight to derive its statistics will not influence the outcome of this market.

This market will conclude based on the data for July 19 as soon as the figures for July 20 are released. The market may not finalize until the July 20 data is accessible. Should no data for July 19 be available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the probability of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For condition (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is Tim Scott going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Tim Scott is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden has a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024.

For criterion (a), it does not matter who the Republican nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For criterion (b), the resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the statistics represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the resolution of this market. If Biden and Trump have the same probability, this market will resolve as 50-50. This market will be resolved based on the data for July 19 as soon as information for July 20 is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will either Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?

This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date.

para_P.title: Is Tim Scott going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will FiveThirtyEight indicate that Biden is favored on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Tim Scott is appointed by the delegates at the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is based on the delegates' choice at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is named the Republican candidate on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. If Biden and Trump have the same probability, this market will split 50-50. The resolution will refer to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, particularly the figures shown by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution for this market.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.
