para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will either Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Donald Trump gives testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, which is determined exclusively by the selections made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the leading group in terms of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be **No** for all other scenarios. In the event that two groups have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

This question will be determined based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and a **No** for all other political factions. In the event that two parties have an equal number of seats, both will be considered a **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will both the Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both the Greens–EFA political group and the GUE/NGL political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If either group does not hold the most seats, this question will resolve as **No**. If the Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL are tied for the most seats, this question resolves as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL groups secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the political group Greens–EFA and the political group GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats after the elections for the European Parliament in 2024. Conversely, if either group fails to secure the most seats, the answer will be **No**. In the event that the Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL achieve a tie for the highest number of seats, the answer will still be **Yes**. The resolution of this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA or GUE/NGL emerge with the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either the Greens–EFA or the GUE/NGL political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. In the event of a tie between two groups for the highest number of seats, this question will also resolve as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question is based on [official declarations from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a tennis player to secure multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if any tennis player obtains two or more medals during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

The determination can be made as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will occur (for instance, if neither team competing in the final event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**. The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) A player secures more than one medal in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics (b) The same country claims more than one gold in women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any player earns at least two medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) each win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have achieved victory in at least two of these events, leading to the inquiry being answered with **Yes**. The question can be resolved as soon as it is evident that one of these conditions will occur (for instance, if neither team in the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Any athlete wins more than one medal for tennis (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: 

(a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This condition resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports. The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g., neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Is it possible for any of the following to take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Any competitor secures more than one medal in tennis (b) A single country achieves victory in more than one women's team sport?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: 

(a) Any competitor earns a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics, specifically in association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This scenario is resolved as **No** if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs secure gold in these eight team sports. The question can be resolved as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will occur (for example, if neither team competing in the final event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but no more than 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative one signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Tim Scott be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) exceeds 2 and is no more than 3 on the graph dated July 15, 2024, as viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead.

2. Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who is declared the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the inquiry will result in **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the date of July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it possible for either of the following scenarios to happen: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 according to 538's national polling average? (b) Will Tim Scott be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Donald Trump holds a lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) that is more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, as indicated on the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

(b) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Tim Scott is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is strictly determined by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or any other appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office through death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (a) Biden is declared unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. If Biden leaves the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., it does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP lawmaker urges Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official announcement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. To be considered a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would consider accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before mid-July 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 (b) Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This requires the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

If either condition (a) or (b) is met, this question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following events will happen prior to mid-July 2024: (a) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment (b) Biden publicly declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if one of the following takes place:

(a) Biden is officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This necessitates that the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office," resulting in the Vice President serving as Acting President. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant. Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. The announcement must be clear and definitive, with no possibility of him accepting the nomination.

If either condition (a) or (b) is satisfied, this question will be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) will collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if, prior to June 30, 2024, there is an official declaration of an electoral partnership or coalition arrangement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is not declared, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: On July 30, 2024, will the Prime Minister of France be part of the Together coalition?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if the Prime Minister of France's party is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election and (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: (a) This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**. (b) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The Republican Party of France (Les Républicains) will establish a political partnership with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election and (b) The Prime Minister of France will be a member of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) This query will be answered with **Yes** if, prior to June 30, 2024, there is an official announcement of an electoral partnership or coalition agreement between the Republican Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), as reported by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such agreement is made public, the answer will be **No**. (b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the political party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to reliable sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024 in France: (a) An electoral alliance between Les Républicains and National Rally, or (b) The Prime Minister belongs to the Together coalition?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together, according to credible sources.

If neither condition is met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: By the middle of 2024, will one of the following take place in France: (a) A coalition between Les Républicains and National Rally, or (b) The Prime Minister is from the Together coalition?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs:

(a) An official announcement of a coalition or electoral alliance between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election) is made before June 30, 2024, as reported by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France is affiliated with the Together coalition, according to reliable sources.

If neither of these scenarios occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If a single ballot suffices, then the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), if only one ballot is required, then this part resolves as **No**. The question resolves as **Yes** only if both conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will the Democrats have to hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are fulfilled: (a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Regarding part (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

As for part (b), if only a single ballot is necessary, then this part resolves as **No**. The question will be answered with **Yes** only if both requirements are satisfied.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than the announcement made on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) The Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this scenario will be answered with **No**.

This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Larry Elder going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be considered as **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates presently listed; additional candidates may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

A positive result indicates a Trump lead, while a negative result indicates Biden is ahead. (b) This question will be resolved as **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will lead to a resolution of **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later. The determination of who receives the Republican nomination is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will either (a) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden exceed 3 but be 4 or less according to 538's national polling average, or (b) will Larry Elder be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as true if the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election shows Donald Trump having a lead over Joe Biden greater than 3 and not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, if on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, this would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is designated as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently in the running; additional candidates may be included later. The determination of this question does not depend on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democratic Party's candidate for President in 2024 will be a woman?
para_P.body:
This will be considered true if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

This will be considered false if the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions for the question to be answered as **Yes**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman (2) The same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(1) The question about the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when they select a male nominee.

(2) The question about the 2024 Olympics will resolve as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as Yes if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (1) A Woman will be the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024 (2) The same country secures victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(1) The inquiry regarding the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024 will be answered with a “yes” when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential election, and it will be “no” when they opt for a male candidate.

(2) The query concerning the 2024 Olympics will be answered as No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, it will be answered as Yes if the same NOC wins at least two of these competitions.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman (b) The same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? This will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(b) Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) A Woman becomes the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024 (b) A single country secures victory in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it possible for the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee to be a Woman? This will be considered “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election. It will be marked “no” if a male candidate is selected instead.

(b) Can the same country achieve victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics? This question will be marked as No if gold medals are won by women's teams from eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) across the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If not, then the same NOC must have triumphed in at least two of these sports, resulting in a Yes.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Kamala's likelihood of victory will rise in the upcoming week as per Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the probability assigned to Harris by the Electoral College in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Nate Silver's model predicts an increase in Kamala's chances of winning over the next week (b) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve to YES if the probability for Harris in Nate Silver's Electoral College model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will resolve to NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Biden will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model or Joe Biden announce not accepting the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a YES resolution for (b), the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If neither condition (a) nor (b) is met, this question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Kamala's chances of winning will rise based on Nate Silver's model or that Joe Biden will publicly declare he is not pursuing the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if one of the following happens: (a) The likelihood of Harris winning in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official public statement indicating he will not seek or accept the Democratic nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. For (b) to qualify for a YES resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a response to voice their dissent regarding their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination ahead of schedule, which they contend suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion about his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and, by sheer force, achieve consensus, but that’s not how it operates,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of the letter.

This market will be marked YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 members of the House or Senators who are affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market as YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will be marked NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Democrats will need a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party finds it necessary to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early:

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024:

This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) At least 20 Democrats in the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the early nomination of Biden, and (b) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly endorse a letter opposing the early nomination of Biden:

Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating efforts to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, arguing that it suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, signifies the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are significantly concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to eliminate debate and achieve unity through sheer force, but that approach is ineffective,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by a minimum of 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be enough to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market resolves to NO.

(b) Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024:

This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. This includes the possibility of multiple letters with a combined total of at least 20 signatures.

(b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic representatives or senators publicly denounce the plan to nominate Biden early, or will there be a contested convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 members from the House or Senate who align with the Democratic Party publicly express opposition to the early nomination strategy before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. This can include several letters that collectively gather at least 20 endorsements.

(b) The Democratic Party will need to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the US presidential election in 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will settle on yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024 and will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, and (b) a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also meet this criterion.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024, and will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, and (b) before the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024, at least 20 members of the House or Senate who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan. Additionally, multiple letters that collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers would fulfill this requirement.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024 or at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president until the conclusion of July 2024, or will a minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the early nomination strategy?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if one of the following takes place: (a) Joe Biden continues to hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) A public letter that opposes the initiative to nominate Biden early receives signatures from no fewer than 20 members of the House or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21, 2024. Several letters that collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice to affirmatively resolve this market.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast dated July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is seen to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that both candidates are given equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically relying on the figures denoted by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight in calculating its data will not affect the resolution of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is accessible. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If no data for July 19 is present by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Biden will be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, or that FiveThirtyEight will indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

Conversely, if just a single ballot suffices, then this question will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination ahead of schedule, which they contend suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain profoundly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to restrict debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter against the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple such letters accumulate a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures, it will also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market closing, this market will resolve to NO.
