question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than an unnamed Democrat, will he receive a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both of which conclude on July 6. One poll presents Manifold participants with a hypothetical ballot featuring Joe Biden, while the other offers a ballot with a generic Democrat.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error, whereas every other Democrat assessed in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or falls within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader electorate?

This market will be deemed YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Others)). The result is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not conclude as N/A and will stay open until their scheduled closing time, regardless of circumstances.

(b) In two Manifold polls closing on July 6, Donald Trump gains at least 3% more votes when facing Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat. The polls ask Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on hypothetical ballots. This condition resolves **Yes** if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more, calculated using the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The difference between the two polls must be >= 0.03 for this condition to resolve **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place: (a) A Trump family member becomes the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024 (b) Trump receives at least 3% more support among Manifold respondents when running against Joe Biden as opposed to a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following criteria is satisfied:

(a) A member of the Trump family is chosen as the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024. This encompasses any of the following individuals:
   - Donald Trump
   - Donald Trump Jr.
   - Eric Trump
   - Ivanka Trump
   - Tiffany Trump
   - Melania Trump
   - Barron Trump

(b) In two Manifold polls concluding on July 6, Donald Trump must achieve a minimum of 3% additional votes when competing against Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat. The polls require Manifold respondents to indicate their vote for Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on hypothetical ballots. This condition resolves as **Yes** if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden surpasses that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more, calculated using the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The difference between the two polls must be >= 0.03 for this condition to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has taken the stand, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran execute a military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will settle on "Yes" if Iran carries out military operations on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries from July 30 until August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If no such action occurs, the market will resolve to "No".

For this market, a "military action" refers to any form of force used by Iran against Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime regions (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility in Israel, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian authorities or supported by a consensus of reliable reports. This encompasses, but is not restricted to, air strikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers are excluded from the resolution of this market.

Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian soil, will be considered for the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by allied forces (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be counted towards the market resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and (2) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(2) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial and (2) Iran launches a military operation on Israeli land prior to August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(2) This market will determine a "Yes" resolution if Iran carries out a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purpose of this market, a "military operation" is defined as any application of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of credible reporting. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers are excluded from the resolution of this market. Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian soil will be considered for the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial or Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, and this action is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. The military action includes any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial or will Iran launch a military operation against Israel prior to August 13, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran commences a military operation on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, and this operation is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by a consensus of credible news reports. The military operation encompasses any use of force carried out by Iran on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime territory, such as aerial bombardments, naval assaults, or ground incursions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered. Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian soil, will be counted. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups will not be included.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Albania competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) to have advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It will be answered with **No** if any other result occurs concerning Albania.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Iceland will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, it will resolve as **No** if that does not occur.

question.title: Will both Albania and Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if either or both countries do not qualify.

para_P.title: Will both Albania and Iceland make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Albania competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will be considered **No** if either or both nations fail to qualify.

question.title: Will either Albania or Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Albania or Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if neither Albania nor Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final.

para_P.title: Are Albania or Iceland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Albania or Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The response will be **No** if neither Albania nor Iceland secures a spot in the Grand Final.

question.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Portugal set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Portugal takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Portugal fails to qualify, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the outcome will be a **No**.

question.title: Will both Portugal and Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Portugal or Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Portugal and Poland set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved in the affirmative (**Yes**) if the following conditions are met: (a) Portugal takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having moved on to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having moved on to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should either Portugal or Poland fail to qualify, the inquiry will be resolved in the negative (**No**).

question.title: Will either Portugal or Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Portugal nor Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Portugal or Poland make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will result in **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Portugal nor Poland advances, the inquiry will result in **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump and Biden's polling numbers be greater than 2 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in polling numbers between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention anticipated for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(2) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition is not met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average, and (2) the Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 2 and will not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538. This is derived from the reported lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump.

(2) The Democratic Party will need multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this condition will not be fulfilled.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, which would indicate a brokered convention. If only one ballot is required, this part resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will either Trump have a lead over Biden that is more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's average national polls, or will the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The national polling average from 538 indicates that Donald Trump holds a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 and is at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, as shown in the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. (b) The Democratic Party needs to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, which would signify a brokered convention. If only a single ballot is necessary, this part will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the leading candidate on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is shown to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is projected to have a better probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast. Should both candidates have equal chances, the outcome will be 50-50.

The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution. Any changes in how FiveThirtyEight computes its data will not affect the resolution of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as information for July 20 is released. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but be 4 or lower, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the measurement of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 538 projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This condition will be satisfied if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(b) This condition will be satisfied if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this condition, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) 538 identifies Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This condition will be fulfilled if Joe Biden is projected to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Any changes in the way FiveThirtyEight computes its data will not affect the resolution of this market. This market will resolve using the data points from July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is available. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, this market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

(b) This condition will be satisfied if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 2 and is at most 4, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this condition, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, (b) Trump have a lead over Biden greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. It will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures.

(b) This will resolve as "Yes" if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a reported value of 2.4 would indicate Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, will either (a) 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner or (b) Trump show a lead over Biden that exceeds 2 but is at most 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered "Yes" if the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, shows Joe Biden with a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. Conversely, it will be deemed "No" if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden on that date. If both candidates are projected to have equal chances, the outcome will be 50-50. The source for this resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically referencing the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will rely on the nearest earlier available data.

(b) This will be marked as "Yes" if the national polling average from FiveThirtyEight shows Donald Trump leading Joe Biden by more than 2 and at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, when this information is accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure shows Biden in the lead. For instance, if the reported value is 2.4, it signifies that Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.body:

It will conclude as **No** for any other political factions. In the event of a tie between two factions for seats, both sub-questions will conclude as **Yes**.

This inquiry resolves based on [official declarations from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This is based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, this condition is considered met.

2. The Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), according to reports from credible sources.

If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the following two events happen: (a) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) The Pandemic Agreement receives approval during the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of these criteria are satisfied:

1. The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. This determination is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources. If there is a tie in the number of seats between two factions, this criterion will be considered fulfilled.

2. The Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned in a vote at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), as reported by trustworthy sources.

If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, or (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
(a) The question regarding the ID political group will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) The question regarding the Pandemic Agreement will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: By mid-2024, will either of the following take place: (a) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, or (b) The Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry concerning the ID political faction will be deemed **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be considered **No** for any other political factions. In cases where two factions are tied for seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**. The resolution of this question will be based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media coverage.

(b) This inquiry regarding the Pandemic Agreement will be resolved as **Yes** if, at the World Health Assembly in May 2024, the Pandemic Agreement is passed in a vote, as reported by trustworthy sources.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the position of President?

This resolves identically to the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This inquiry will be resolved as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and background information are available on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users who are somewhat reliable are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request an early resolution or report any issues.

Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is open to the inclusion of additional candidates beyond those currently listed; future options may arise. The outcome of this question is not dependent on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly determined by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden's announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be explicit and final: it should eliminate any doubt that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as No.

question.title: Will either Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For part (a), the resolution is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

For part (b), to qualify for a Yes resolution, Joe Biden's statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that he would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to the deadline, this part will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or that Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following events takes place: (a) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Regarding part (a), the outcome is based on who the delegates of the Republican National Convention select, irrespective of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

Concerning part (b), for a Yes outcome, Joe Biden's announcement must be clear and definitive, with no indication that he would consider accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this part will be resolved as No.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are currently available, both set to close on July 6. One of these polls asks Manifold participants to cast their vote with Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other inquires about their vote with a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in hypothetical scenarios tends to lead or fall within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls finalize.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local media that they believe Biden's prospects for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the activity is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts is intended to request that Biden conclude his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate collaborates to encourage Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to actively push him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as a signed letter as mentioned earlier, or through a collective discussion with Biden where they jointly request that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, this will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden with a request for him to step aside will not fulfill the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are made public before the market concludes. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden and will a group of at least 5 named Democrats pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, this question resolves YES. If either condition is not met, this question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Trump will receive a minimum of 3% support from Manifold participants against Biden, and will a coalition of at least five identified Democrats urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) Two Manifold polls are conducted, both closing on July 6. One poll solicits Manifold participants to cast their vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot. This market will resolve to YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater at the time both polls close. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the outcome is NO.

(b) A coalition of no fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could manifest as a signed letter as reported, or through another method such as a group discussion with Biden where they collectively request him to step aside. This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Five individuals independently informing reporters of their belief that Biden should withdraw is inadequate for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting he step down will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's conclusion. In any unclear situations where such names are mentioned but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If both criteria (a) and (b) are met, this question will resolve YES. If either criterion is not satisfied, this question will resolve NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, or (b) a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat: There are two Manifold polls closing on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another with a generic Democrat. This will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll exceeds the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat + Someone else)) for each poll, and the difference must be >= 0.03 for a YES resolution.

(b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th: This resolves YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, either by signing a letter or another form of collective request. All five must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed Democrats are insufficient unless names are made public before the end date.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% support among Manifold respondents when compared to Biden rather than a generic Democrat, or (b) at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
(a) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% support among Manifold respondents when compared to Biden rather than a generic Democrat: Two Manifold polls are closing on July 6. One poll asks participants to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other features a generic Democrat. This will be marked YES if Trump's percentage in the Biden poll surpasses that of the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat + Someone else)) for each poll, and the difference must be >= 0.03 for a YES outcome.

(b) At least 5 identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th: This will be marked YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign prior to July 20th, whether by signing a letter or another form of collective appeal. All five must be part of the same group communication. Reports of unnamed Democrats are not adequate unless names are disclosed publicly before the deadline.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will resolve as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place *after* the specified date. It strictly focuses on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The question will resolve as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any later reversals that may occur after the specified date. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

The inquiry will resolve as negative if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Mike Pence going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:

Any other candidates will be considered as **No**. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being introduced in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it is not significant who ends up receiving the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based exclusively on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Czech Republic competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Belgium nor Czech Republic qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the leading group in terms of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both related questions will be answered with **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT by OpenAI be accessible to the public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

In this context, "accessible to the public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly requiring a subscription). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as it was in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), the resolution will still be positive, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers specifically to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, the Greens–EFA will have the highest number of seats, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group possesses the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be answered with **No** for any other results. If there is a tie in the number of seats between two groups, both parts of the question will be answered as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements made by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy news sources.

(b) The answer to the question will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "broadly accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is to have access without a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in some EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to specific groups (for example, minors), the question will still resolve positively as long as over 50% of the population can utilize it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either the Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections or will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This includes ties for the most seats, in which case it will still resolve as **Yes**. The resolution will be based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It will resolve as **Yes** even if unavailable in certain EU countries or to specific demographics like minors, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it resolves positively if the service remains substantially the same, even if the name or website changes.

para_P.title: After the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will either the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats or will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) The Greens–EFA group possesses the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. This includes situations where there is a tie for the highest number of seats, in which case it will still be marked as **Yes**. The conclusion will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources. (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" signifies that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without needing a VPN, which may involve a fee. It will be marked as **Yes** even if it is not available in certain EU nations or for specific groups such as minors, as long as over 50% of the population can access it. The term "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it will be positively resolved if the service remains largely unchanged, even if the name or website undergoes modifications.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Czechia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.title: Is Azerbaijan going to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will both Czechia and Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will either Czechia or Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.title: Will Czechia or Azerbaijan make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
