Conversely, if neither Czechia nor Azerbaijan qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

para_P.title: Will the critics' rating for "Twisters" (2024) on Rotten Tomatoes reach a minimum of 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
para_P.body:
The Rotten Tomatoes page for "Twisters" (2024)

This will be considered a YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or above, one week post-release (July 26th).

Additional Information

I will refer to the precision indicated by Rotten Tomatoes (generally an integer percentage, without decimals).

As an example, the original "Twister" (1996) has a current Tomatometer score of 63%. This is the score I will apply.

The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for reference only (to my knowledge, it necessitates a score of 75% or more on the Tomatometer, but there may be other criteria—the market resolves based solely on the score shown).

"Twisters" (2024) serves as a separate sequel to the original from 1996, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend box office earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the total of those for "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported on Boxofficemojo at the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) surpasses $185,548,391, which is the aggregate of the box office earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% and will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) "Twisters" (2024) has a Tomatometer score of 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th), as displayed on Rotten Tomatoes. The score used will be the integer percentage listed by Rotten Tomatoes. (2) The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391, which is the combined sum of the box openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which are $132,434,639 and $53,113,752 respectively.

para_P.title: Will the critics' rating for "Twisters" (2024) on Rotten Tomatoes reach a minimum of 75%, and will the domestic box office debut of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the total earnings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body: This will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) "Twisters" (2024) achieves a Tomatometer score of 75% or more, one week post-release (July 26th), as shown on Rotten Tomatoes. The score referenced will be the whole number percentage provided by Rotten Tomatoes. (2) The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" as reported by Boxofficemojo on the film's page exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which are $132,434,639 and $53,113,752 respectively.

question.title: Will either "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% or "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) "Twisters" (2024) achieves a Rotten Tomatoes Tomatometer score of 75% or higher, one week after its release (July 26th), based on the score displayed on its Rotten Tomatoes page. The score will be taken as an integer percentage, as listed by Rotten Tomatoes. (b) The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, as reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page. This amount is the combined box office opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which were $132,434,639 and $53,113,752 respectively.

para_P.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) receive a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%, or will "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the domestic box office opening of both "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body: This question is answered with **Yes** if either of the following happens: (a) "Twisters" (2024) obtains a Rotten Tomatoes Tomatometer score of 75% or greater, one week after its premiere on July 26th, according to the rating shown on its Rotten Tomatoes page. The score will be considered as an integer percentage, as indicated by Rotten Tomatoes. (b) The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceeds $185,548,391, as noted by Boxofficemojo on the film's page. This figure represents the total box office opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which were $132,434,639 and $53,113,752 respectively.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 in the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia surpass Apple in market capitalization on June 28th, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will result in **Yes** if, as of June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, based on data from [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), as verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This occurs if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is reported as greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) This occurs if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden is reported to be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Nvidia's valuation surpasses that of Apple on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This happens if the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election shows that Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.

(b) This takes place if, on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when reviewed by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3 based on 538's national polling average? (b) Will Nvidia's market valuation surpass that of Apple on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) The lead that Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, as noted in the chart for that date when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead.

(b) On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault linked to Israel and taking place within Iran has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following events will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution of this inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) This question will be marked **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an assault attributed to Israel, occurring within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Credible reports indicate that, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, or will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if one of the following scenarios takes place:

1. Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election that is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure shows Biden is ahead.

2. Reliable sources report that, after the publication date of this question and prior to May 1, 2024, an attack linked to Israel occurring within the borders of Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. If any other candidate is chosen, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently announced; additional candidates may emerge later.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) during the special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an authoritative statement from an Ohio State source will be utilized. If the election does not take place before January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A person representing the Republican Party must win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be resolved based on credible sources reporting the win, or an Ohio State source or statement if there is disagreement among popular sources. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to happen: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) the Republican Party secures Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson needs to be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is ultimately chosen on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A candidate from the Republican Party has to win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be confirmed by reliable news sources reporting the victory, or by an official statement from an Ohio State source if there is a conflict among major sources. If there is no election conducted before January 1, 2025, this portion of the question will be considered void.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. For (a), any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**, and it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. For (b), if popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used, and if no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Republican Party holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Tucker Carlson is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) reliable sources indicate that a Republican Party representative has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. For (a), if any other candidate is chosen, it will be recorded as **No**, and the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the decision is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. For (b), in the event of conflicting reports from popular sources, an Ohio State source or official statement will be considered definitive, and if no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be voided.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) experience an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, subsequent to the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources confirm that an assault credited to Israel, taking place within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be considered higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the number reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than that reported on July 20, 2023, as seen here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be considered to have carried out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, if credible reports indicate that, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Israel conducts a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be deemed higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the figure published by the St. Louis Fed on that date exceeds the one reported on July 20, 2023, as illustrated here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be regarded as having executed a lethal strike within Iran before May 1, 2024, if reliable reports confirm that, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, an attack linked to Israel occurring within Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: (a) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. (b) The question about Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be greater on July 20, 2024, compared to a year earlier? (b) Will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) The resolution regarding the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will depend on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported on July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023. (b) The inquiry regarding Israel conducting a lethal attack within Iran will resolve as **Yes** if, after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iranian territory resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Nikki Haley going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will lead to a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently in the running; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain president until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will determine a yes outcome if Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden will still be president by 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, if he is officially holding the office of President of the United States at that time.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden remains in office as president by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if the Republican National Convention selects her as their nominee. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on the date of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden will continue to be president by 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, if he is officially in the role of President of the United States at that moment.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of these scenarios will happen: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following situations occurs: (a) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the office of President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden continues to serve as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be deemed NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (The role of Acting President differs from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Ron DeSantis going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. The determination is exclusively based on who the delegates of the Republican National Convention select.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both (a) Biden stays in office until the end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Biden is still the US President at the close of July 2024 (ET); it will be marked as NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution).

(b) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to currently listed candidates; additional options may be introduced later. For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election. It is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 or Ron DeSantis become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); this resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution) OR (b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. All other candidates will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to stay in office until the end of July 2024, or for Ron DeSantis to be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve to YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden continues as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will resolve to NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (which involves appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution) OR (b) Ron DeSantis is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the Republican National Convention delegates, not by who is announced as the nominee on election day. All other candidates will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's advantage. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris set to be the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: Should Kamala Harris receive the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if another individual is appointed as VP, this market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP position after the original nomination will not affect the outcome of this market. The market may resolve right after the nomination is made.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the value must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 for this condition to be met.
(b) Kamala Harris must be nominated as the Democratic VP. If she is nominated, this condition is met, regardless of any changes after the initial nomination. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris be selected as the Democratic Vice Presidential nominee?
para_P.body:
(a) The margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden will be assessed based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, which Metaculus accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump advantage, and this figure must be greater than 2 and at most 4 for this condition to hold true.
(b) Kamala Harris must receive the nomination as the Democratic Vice President. This condition is satisfied if she is nominated, irrespective of any subsequent developments after her initial nomination. The market can resolve right after the nomination.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to YES. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to NO. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 4 in 538's national polling average, or will Kamala Harris be selected as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The national polling average from 538 indicates that Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and not more than 4 on July 15, 2024, as shown on the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates a lead for Biden. (b) Kamala Harris receives the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency. If Kamala Harris is indeed nominated as the Democratic VP, this inquiry will conclude with a YES. If a different individual is chosen for the Vice Presidency, the outcome will be NO. Any subsequent changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this inquiry. The market may resolve right after the nomination.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Will any tennis player secure multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve at Least 21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will result in a "No". 

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have attained 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for the second condition will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. The market for the second condition will resolve immediately to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games: (1) A tennis player secures more than one medal, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes achieve a total of 21 or more gold medals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) Any tennis player is awarded at least two medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes together earn 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The official medal count provided by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reputable sources, should the IOC's reporting be unavailable, will serve as the basis for determining the second criterion. The market for the second criterion will resolve to "Yes" immediately if it is verified that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games.

question.title: Will either an athlete win more than one medal for tennis or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, (b) will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Is it possible for a tennis player to secure over one medal or for Individual Neutral Athletes to achieve at least 21 gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Any tennis player obtains a minimum of two medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes together earn 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources will serve as the basis for determining (b) if the IOC's reporting is not available. Should it be verified that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, (b) will be resolved to "Yes" immediately.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a live, on-camera discussion for over 45 minutes before July 2024 concludes?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred in April when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

For this market to resolve to YES, Biden must engage in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. If no such interview is available before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include podcast appearances or late-night show segments, or interviews featured in programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in person. A 50-minute video might only include 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count.

As a reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can access a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump and Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the measurement of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, AND (2) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. Qualifying interviews include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count. 

(2) According to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The value will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: Will there be both of the following events: (1) Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, AND (2) Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to take part in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, which must be released before the end of July 2024. Acceptable interviews include those on podcasts, late-night television shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, featuring at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Events such as press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not qualify. 

(2) According to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden must exceed 3 and be at most 4 points. A positive number signifies a Trump lead. This value will be verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes, or (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be in-person and feature at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Qualifying appearances include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, but not press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc. 

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) Joe Biden engage in an in-person interview lasting over 45 minutes, or (b) will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview recorded on camera for a minimum of 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024. The interview should be in-person and include at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Acceptable formats include podcasts, late-night television shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, but not press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc. 

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is more than 3 and at most 4 points based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reflected in the chart for that date when viewed on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump.

question.body:

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic lawmakers in the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their objections to their party's initiative to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite troubled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to verify the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 members of the House or Senators who affiliate with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either: (a) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden remains in office as president by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be settled based on the lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For clarity, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(b) This market will be deemed affirmative if, at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still recognized as the president of the United States.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to publicly oppose their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are profoundly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He declined to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also be enough for this market to resolve to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

If such a clear announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be marked as No.

Additional details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Liz Cheney is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is designated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the individuals currently mentioned; additional candidates may be included later. The outcome is solely based on who is nominated by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This inquiry will be resolved as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, with no ambiguity regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as No.

question.title: Will either Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination. If neither of these events occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Liz Cheney will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or that Joe Biden will publicly declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based on the selection made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention, not on the individual who receives the Republican nomination on Election Day in 2024. (b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive, with no ambiguity regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic nomination. If neither of these scenarios occurs, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

This inquiry resolves based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but be at most 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.body:

For the purpose of this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.
