If either or both of these conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommends that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk, and (2) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholders' meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board, and (2) Donald Trump Jr. is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either or both of these criteria are not satisfied, the question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) ISS advises against Elon Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, or (b) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors, or (b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If neither event occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) ISS recommends against Elon Musk's compensation package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, or (b) Donald Trump Jr. is nominated as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla investors to oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board, or (b) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If neither of these scenarios occurs, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be president by this Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Kamala Harris, the Vice President, is officially recognized as the President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for resolving this market will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

Resolver

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump will face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks related to possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be brought before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

(b) This question resolves to "Yes" if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Kamala Harris assumes the role of President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable news reporting.

(b) This question will be considered "Yes" if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any comments related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris become president by July 26, 2024, or Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used. (b) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to assume the presidency by July 26, 2024, or for Donald Trump to face charges of witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, though a consensus of reliable news reporting will also be considered. (b) Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any comments made about potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. Such charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Will there be an assault on the Crimean Bridge prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, following May 2, 2024, and preceding the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly threaten the structural integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The Crimean Bridge experiences an attack prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains in office as president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (1) Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with weapons, explosives, or projectiles that could realistically threaten the bridge's structural integrity. (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still serving as the official president of the United States.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

(b) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place: (a) the Crimean Bridge suffers an attack prior to July 1, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden remains president at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either of the following happens:

(a) Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could threaten the structural integrity of the bridge.

(b) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw from the race and step down from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement indicating that he is no longer pursuing re-election and that he will be resigning from his current presidential term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time; however, he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated the office by that date. A declaration of his plan to do so will suffice to resolve this market.

If he does not make these announcements, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

[image]

para_P.title: Will the value of USD reach or exceed 145 JPY (yen) by the end of trading on August 9th, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning before the end of July 2024, and (2) USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this component YES. Otherwise, this component resolves NO on August 1st.

(2) Resolves YES if the USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance is greater than or equal to 145. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following events take place: (1) Joe Biden declares he is stepping down and resigning prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) the value of USD reaches at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Resolves to YES if Joe Biden makes public announcements stating that he is withdrawing from the race for re-election and that he intends to resign, thereby not finishing his current term. These statements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A declaration of his plan to do so suffices to resolve this part as YES. Otherwise, this part resolves to NO on August 1st.

(2) Resolves to YES if the USD/JPY closing figure reported for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance is at least 145. If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning or (b) USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient. Otherwise, this part resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if the USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance is greater than or equal to 145 JPY. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens before their specified deadlines: (a) Joe Biden declares he is withdrawing from the race and stepping down or (b) the USD reaches a value of at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked YES if Joe Biden makes a public statement indicating that he is no longer in the running for re-election and that he will be resigning from his current position, provided these statements are made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. It is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and vacated his office by the end of July; a declaration of his intent to resign is adequate. If this does not occur, this part will be marked NO on August 1st.

(b) This will be marked YES if the closing value of the USD/JPY on Yahoo! Finance for August 9th, 2024, is 145 JPY or higher. If it is lower, it will be marked NO.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli leaders prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below. It will be answered with **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (2) the ICC issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(2) Resolves YES if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as NO otherwise.
* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Biden will be officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024 and (2) the ICC will release arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity does not affect this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

(2) This will be considered YES if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be considered NO otherwise.
* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (1) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, or (2) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff).

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following events will take place prior to their deadlines: (1) Biden being declared unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (2) the ICC releasing arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that President Biden is incapable of fulfilling the responsibilities of his position, leading to the Vice President acting as President. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the following members of the Israeli cabinet: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff).

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Nikki Haley going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other contenders will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be affirmed with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Background: A GOP legislator has requested Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not qualify. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (2) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Nikki Haley becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or that Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (1) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) The Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and responsibilities of his office," thereby allowing the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings in the domestic market for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the total of those for "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) surpasses $185,548,391, which is the aggregate of the box office figures for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination for President from the Democratic Party?

This resolves the same as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional fine print and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the result is known and clear. Feel free to ping @jskf for requests for early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently under consideration; additional options may emerge later.

In this context, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (b) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by this deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (b) Chris Christie becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden going to make a declaration before July 15, 2024 that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a declaration is not made by this deadline, it will be answered with No.

(b) Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be answered with Yes if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Chris Christie is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

(b) Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following takes place: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Chris Christie becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it true that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official public announcement stating that he will not seek nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive.

(b) Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will be considered Yes if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who is nominated by the Republican Party on election day.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to both withdraw from the race and step down from the presidency prior to July's conclusion?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be resigning from his position, not finishing his current term. These statements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated the office by that time. A declaration of his plan to do so is adequate to resolve this market.

If not, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must take place before June 1, 2024.

question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this component.

Otherwise, this component resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

The overall question resolves YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden will declare his withdrawal and resignation from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump will face charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is stepping down from the race for re-election and that he intends to resign, thereby not finishing his current term. These declarations need to happen before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A statement of his plan to do so is adequate to resolve this part positively.

If not, this segment will be deemed NO on August 1st.

(b) This will be marked as YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any remarks related to possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

The entire question will be answered YES only if both (a) and (b) are answered YES.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (1) Joe Biden announces both dropping out and resigning from the presidency, or (2) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: 

1. Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient.

2. Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

If neither of these events occurs by their respective deadlines, this question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place prior to their deadlines: (1) Joe Biden declares both his withdrawal from the presidential race and his resignation from the presidency, or (2) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if at least one of the following happens: 

1. Joe Biden publicly states that he is no longer seeking re-election and that he intends to resign from his current presidential term. These statements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A declaration of his plan to do so is adequate.

2. Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any remarks about potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

If neither of these scenarios occurs by their respective deadlines, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be named president by Friday?

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their dissent against their party’s move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they contend suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues remain significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman mentioned in an interview. He chose not to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters that collectively gather 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be president by Friday and will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing the early nomination plan?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting, AND (b) a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, as reported by credible sources, including the possibility of multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures. If either condition is not met, this question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to assume the presidency by Friday, and will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a letter against the early nomination strategy?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, according to official announcements from the US government or a consensus of reliable news reports, AND (b) a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by no fewer than 20 members of the House or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the conclusion of Sunday, July 21st, as reported by trustworthy sources, which may include multiple letters that together total at least 20 signatures. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the answer to this question will be NO.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris be president by Friday or will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question combines two separate forecasting questions:

(a) Kamala Harris as President by Friday: This resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Opposition to Biden's Early Nomination Plan: This resolves to "Yes" if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are sufficient.

This combined question resolves to "Yes" if either (a) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President by the specified time, or (b) at least 20 Democratic lawmakers sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan by the specified deadline.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Kamala Harris will assume the presidency by Friday, or that a minimum of 20 Democratic House/Senate members will endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
This inquiry merges two distinct forecasting questions:

(a) Kamala Harris assuming the presidency by Friday: This is affirmed with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main sources for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, along with a consensus from reliable news reports.

(b) Opposition to Biden's Early Nomination Proposal: This is affirmed with a "Yes" if a public statement opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 House Representatives or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Multiple statements with a total of 20 signatures are acceptable.

This combined inquiry will be resolved as "Yes" if either (a) Kamala Harris is recognized as President or Acting President by the designated time, or (b) a minimum of 20 Democratic legislators sign a public statement opposing the early nomination proposal by the given deadline.

question.title: Will either Georgia or Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Georgia or Malta make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither advances, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to the inclusion of additional candidates in the future beyond those currently listed.

For the purpose of this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is solely based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democratic Party's candidate for President in 2024 will be a female?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential candidate for the upcoming election in 2024.

This will be marked as “no” if the Democratic delegates opt for a male candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Will Hurd to become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election while a woman is chosen as the Democratic candidate for the same election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Will Hurd is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This appointment is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) The Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential candidate for the 2024 election. The inquiry will conclude with a **No** if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. 

(a) For Will Hurd to be the Republican nominee, he must be selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

(b) For the Democratic Presidential Nominee to be a woman, the Democratic delegates must select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. If a male is selected, this part resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will take place: (a) Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) a Woman is chosen as the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Hurd is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election. 

(a) For Hurd to be the Republican candidate, he must be nominated by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is strictly based on the nomination made at the Republican National Convention.

(b) For a woman to be the Democratic Presidential Nominee, the Democratic delegates must select a female candidate for the 2024 election. If a male candidate is chosen, this part will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will resolve to YES if Biden takes part in another in-person interview for at least 45 minutes. If no such qualifying interview is available before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include podcast appearances or late-night shows, or interviews edited into programs like 60 Minutes, but there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showcasing Biden being interviewed in person for these to qualify. For example, a 50-minute video may only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can access a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be confirmed through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It specifically addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, leading to him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024 (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

(b) Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The removal or block is strictly considered as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after this date.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024 (b) Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden is required to engage in an in-person interview for no less than 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but may include guest appearances on a podcast or late-night television program, or an interview that is edited into a show like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed face-to-face.

(b) Donald Trump needs to be officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be validated through formal announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible news reports. The disqualification or barring is strictly considered as of July 15, 2024, and does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might happen after this date.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden have a qualifying in-person interview or Donald Trump be removed from any primary ballot by July 2024?
question.body:
The question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following occurs:

(a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc.

(b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

If neither of these conditions are met, the question resolves as "No."

para_P.title: By July 2024, will Joe Biden have participated in a qualifying in-person interview or will Donald Trump be disqualified from any primary ballot?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Joe Biden engages in an in-person interview or on-camera discussion lasting 45 minutes or more before the conclusion of July 2024. This encompasses appearances on podcasts or late-night television shows, or interviews that are part of a program such as 60 Minutes, as long as there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person. It excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town halls, etc.

(b) Donald Trump is either removed from or prevented from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, by July 15, 2024. The removal or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

If neither condition is satisfied, the answer will be "No."

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a typical Democrat on the same ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically polled is either leading or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will resolve to YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The response is YES if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If they fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Croatia and Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Croatia and Malta participate in their respective Semi-finals and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Croatia and Malta going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both Croatia and Malta take part in their individual Semi-finals and are subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, it will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will either Croatia or Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Croatia or Malta make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Croatia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither nation qualifies, the answer will be **No**.
